data.title: Dorsalis Pedis Arteries : Wheeless' Textbook of Orthopaedics
data.meta_description: - See posterior tibial artery - Anatomy:     - anterior tibial artery passes from behind through gap above interosseous membrane to enter anterior compartment of leg and supply its muscles;     - as it crosses membrane, it gives off a  recurrent branch;             - ref: The risk of injury to anterior tibial artery in posterolateral approach to ...
